```Python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('azureml://subscriptions/901e11c6-42ed-4fcc-875a-6bd77390af5b/resourcegroups/AIGroup/workspaces/KinfeyAOAIWS/datastores/onelake_ds_demo3/paths/Files/csv/ProductList.csv')

product_count = df['Product Type'].value_counts()

plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
product_count.plot(kind='bar')
plt.xlabel('Product Type')
plt.ylabel('Number of Products')
plt.xticks(rotation=270)
plt.title('Number of Products by Product Type')
plt.show()
```
Please note that this code assumes that your dataframe has a column named `Product Type`. If the column name is different, please replace `'Product Type'` with the actual column name.

Also note that the path to the CSV file in Azure ML is not a typical file path and can't be directly used with `pd.read_csv()`. The path should be a local path or a URL. If your data is in Azure ML, you would first need to download the file or read it using Azure ML-specific code.
